assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DX 2.0.0; FALCON-Unzip v. DX 1.1.0; purge_dups v. DX 19-08-10; scaff10X v. DX 2.0.3; bionano Solve v. DX 3.4.0; Salsa2 HiC v. DX 2.2.0; Arrow polishing and gap filling v. DX 7.0.1.1; Longranger Align v. DX 2.2.2.1; freebayes v. DX 19-07-11; gEVAL manual curation v. 2020-04-24; VGP assembly pipeline v. 1.6

bioprojects.title: Sylvia borin (Garden warbler) genome, bSylBor1, alternate haplotype

description.comment: The garden warbler (Sylvia borin) is songbird, and one of the most studied for it migratory behavior between its breeding grounds in Europe to its wintering grounds in central Africa. During migration, they can metabolize up to 19% of their breast muscle and 39% of their digestive tract. They also have a rich diverse song. This sample was collected by Julia Slezacek of a female from Ponza Island, Italy, and procured for studies on migration by Silvia Fuselli, Steve Smith, and Leonida Fusani, to generate a chromosome level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Animal sample from Sylvia borin

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Garden warbler sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Sylvia borin. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project JACEWE000000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
